_description: An exposition of the Pater Noster — 128 lines in couplets

BodAddE6.First Lines:
Lestnit nou and habbit lest þe loue of ihesu cristȝe
                    þat betȝ in trewe be leueLestnet nou and betȝ naȝt deue
                    …
BodAddE6.Last Lines:
…þoru his hestis þat ben tenSey we now alle
                    amen
BodAddE6.Note:
Lines of Latin Pater Noster are inserted into the text of the poem. At
                    the end of the poem ‘Explicit pater noster’.
BodAddE6.Editions:
Pfander,  Homer Garrison. 
             “The Popular Sermon of the Medieval Friar in England.” 
         Diss. New York University, 1937: 41-4.
